Installer.name: Installer
Installer.summary: The installer script (Accessable under https://skydocs.madefor.cc/scripts/installer.lua) takes a JSON file, online, or locally stored and installs files from it, according to it's location.

SkyOS Desktop.name: SkyOS Desktop
SkyOS Desktop.summary: The desktop for SkyOS is stored in settings/desktop.dat, which is a serialized table (textutils.serialize()), and it's d...

SkyOS Settings.name: SkyOS Settings
SkyOS Settings.summary: The SkyOS settings file (Found at settings/general.cfg) contains a number of options to change how SkyOS works.

SkyOS.back().name: SkyOS.back()
SkyOS.back().summary: SkyOS.back() is called when the back button (the < on the task bar) is pressed.

SkyOS.close().name: SkyOS.close()
SkyOS.close().summary: SkyOS.close() is called whenever the window is about to be closed.

SkyOS.visible().name: SkyOS.visible()
SkyOS.visible().summary: SkyOS.isVisible(isVisible) is called whenever the window changes it's visibility state, and therefore active state.

TCP Install Guide.name: TCP Install Guide
TCP Install Guide.summary: To install the TCP module, run: wget run https://skydocs.madefor.cc/scripts/installtcp.lua This will:

To-Do.name: To-Do
To-Do.summary: List of TODO: lines in src/, build/docs/lua/scripts,  and build/docs/lua/scriptdata:

WIP Projects.name: WIP Projects
WIP Projects.summary: Projects stored under this category are projects that are incomplete, you shouldn't use them.

back.name: back
back.summary: The back event is called when the back button is pressed on the action bar.

bimg.name: bimg
bimg.summary: An API that draws and manipulates .

bimg.Image.clearMetadata.name: bimg.Image.clearMetadata()
bimg.Image.clearMetadata.summary: This clears the metadata, useful to completely overwrite metadata.

bimg.Image.save.name: bimg.Image.save([path])
bimg.Image.save.summary: Save the image to the file.

bimg.Image.setPixel.name: bimg.Image.setPixel(...)
bimg.Image.setPixel.summary: Set a pixel at a specific point.

bimg.Image:getMetadata.name: bimg.Image:getMetadata()
bimg.Image:getMetadata.summary: Retrieve the metadata of the image.

bimg.Image:reload.name: bimg.Image:reload()
bimg.Image:reload.summary: Refresh the image from the file.

bimg.Image:setMetadata.name: bimg.Image:setMetadata(metadata)
bimg.Image:setMetadata.summary: Set the metadata of the image.

bufferedinput.name: bufferedinput
bufferedinput.summary: A direct port of one of my Python libraries.

bufferedinput.read.name: bufferedinput.read(?)
bufferedinput.read.summary: Read a string, and call the callback each letter, with the buffer as an argument.

button.name: button
button.summary: A simple button api with the option of drawing an image on the button.

button.delete.name: button.delete(id)
button.delete.summary: Remove a button from being clicked.

button.drawButton.name: button.drawButton(id)
button.drawButton.summary: Draw a button again, drawing its tDraw, or nothing if there is no image.

button.drawButtons.name: button.drawButtons()
button.drawButtons.summary: Draw every button, this loops through the buttons table.

button.edit.name: button.edit(id [, x [, y [, width [, height [, func [, image]]]]]])
button.edit.summary: Edit a button, changing its function, position, or whatnot.

button.exec.name: button.exec(event [, drag [, monitor]])
button.exec.summary: Takes an event in a table, checks if it's a mouse_click or mouse_drag, and sees if it's within a button, if so, execute its function.

button.new.name: button.new(x, y, width, height, function [, image [, enabled]])
button.new.summary: Create a button, and add it to the internal table of buttons.

ccsql.name: ccsql
ccsql.summary: An API that connects to the ccsql server and allows requests.

ccsql.Connection.execute.name: ccsql.Connection.execute(query)
ccsql.Connection.execute.summary: Execute a statement and ignore the result.

ccsql.Connection.fetchrow.name: ccsql.Connection.fetchrow(query)
ccsql.Connection.fetchrow.summary: Fetch the first row from the query.

ccsql.open.name: ccsql.open(host [, username [, password]])
ccsql.open.summary: Opens a connection to the requested Postgresql server.

cipher.name: cipher
cipher.summary: Provides various cipher functions, such as a Caesar cipher, and Viginere cipher.

cipher.caesar.name: cipher.caesar(input [, shift=-3])
cipher.caesar.summary: Run a Caesar Cipher on the provided string.

cipher.letterTable.name: cipher.letterTable
cipher.letterTable.summary: Just a numerically indiced table that contains every letter of the alphabet (English alphabet.

cipher.rot13.name: cipher.rot13(input, The)
cipher.rot13.summary: Run a ROT13 cipher on the input.

cipher.shiftLetter.name: cipher.shiftLetter(letter, modifier)
cipher.shiftLetter.summary: Shift a single letter by a modifier.

cipher.viginere.name: cipher.viginere(input, key)
cipher.viginere.summary: Run a Viginere cipher on the provided string.

cipher.viginereDecode.name: cipher.viginereDecode(input, key)
cipher.viginereDecode.summary: Reverse a Viginere cipher on the provided string.

comms.name: comms
comms.summary: This is a communications library for SkyOS to facilitate communication with in world computers.

coro.activeCoros.name: coro.activeCoros
coro.activeCoros.summary: Currently active coroutines, with pid as key.

coro.killCoro.name: coro.killCoro(coro)
coro.killCoro.summary: Kill a coroutine, and remove it from the coroutine table.

coro.newCoro.name: coro.newCoro(func [, name [, parent [, env [, forceActive]]]])
coro.newCoro.summary: Make a new coroutine and add it to the currently running list.

coro.resume.name: coro.resume(pid, ...)
coro.resume.summary: Resume a coroutine with a custom event, with error handling and such.

coro.stop.name: coro.stop()
coro.stop.summary: Stop the coroutine manager, halting all threads after current loop.

crash.name: crash
crash.summary: This library will handle crash reports, generating crash reports.

crash.crashreport.name: crash.crashreport(stacktrace, error [, msg])
crash.crashreport.summary: Generate and save a crash report.

create!piston.name: piston.piston.curHeight = 0
create!piston.summary: Current height of the piston, this should always match the piston in the world.

devbin.name: devbin
devbin.summary: Provides a devbin api to interact with devbin without using the devbin shell command.

file.name: file
file.summary: The file library is a deprecated library that loaded .skgrp files, it has been assimilated into sUtils

file.countLines.name: file.countLines(file)
file.countLines.summary: Count the number of lines in the file.

file.getSize.name: file.getSize(path)
file.getSize.summary: Recursively get the size of a folder.

file.loadAppGraphics.name: file.loadAppGraphics(file, file, name)
file.loadAppGraphics.summary: loadAppGraphics is a function that was supposed to load icons in certain places, but was never finished and does not function.

file.loadGrpLines.name: file.loadGrpLines(file, output)
file.loadGrpLines.summary: Load a .skgrp file onto the screen.

file.split.name: file.split(inputstr, sep)
file.split.summary: Split a string by it's separator.

gestures.name: gestures
gestures.summary: Takes various mouse events, and converts them into other events, such as long press, pan, and swipe.

gestures.longPress.name: gestures.longPress([debug=false])
gestures.longPress.summary: Run the long press manager, with an optional debug variable.

gestures.pan.name: gestures.pan([debug=false])
gestures.pan.summary: Run the pan event, which is triggered when the user is dragging on the screen.

gestures.pan_up.name: gestures.pan_up([debug=false])
gestures.pan_up.summary: Run the pan_up manager, which is triggered when a pan event stops happening, and includes the total distance moved with an optional debug variable.

gestures.stop.name: gestures.stop()
gestures.stop.summary: Stop the gesture functions, can be restarted by calling run again.

gestures.swipe.name: gestures.swipe([debug=false])
gestures.swipe.summary: Run the swipe manager, with an optional debug variable.

gestures.swipeDirections.name: gestures.swipeDirections
gestures.swipeDirections.summary: Table that converts a normalized vector into swipe directions.

graphic.name: graphic
graphic.summary: The graphic library is a wrapper around paintutils.

graphic.drawBox.name: graphic.drawBox(x, y, x2, y2, colour, output)
graphic.drawBox.summary: drawBox draws a hollow box at the specified coordinates

graphic.drawFilledBox.name: graphic.drawFilledBox(x, y, x2, y2, colour, output)
graphic.drawFilledBox.summary: drawFilledBox draws a filled in box at the specified coordinates

graphic.drawLine.name: graphic.drawLine(x1, y2, x2, y2, colour, output)
graphic.drawLine.summary: drawLine draws a line between the two coordinates

graphic.drawPixel.name: graphic.drawPixel(x, y, colour, output)
graphic.drawPixel.summary: drawPixel draws a single pixel at the specified coordinates

graphic.drawText.name: graphic.drawText(x, y, fg, bg, text, output)
graphic.drawText.summary: drawText draws a textline with set colours

imgconvert.name: imgconvert
imgconvert.summary: Convert skimg to other filetypes, and other filetypes to skimgs.

imgconvert.blit.limg.name: imgconvert.blit.limg(blit)
imgconvert.blit.limg.summary: Convert a blit image to limg image.

imgconvert.blit.skimg.name: imgconvert.blit.skimg(blit, `skimg`)
imgconvert.blit.skimg.summary: Convert a blit image to a skimg image.

imgconvert.skimg.blit.name: imgconvert.skimg.blit(skimg)
imgconvert.skimg.blit.summary: Convert a skimg image to a blit image.

imgconvert.skimg.limg.name: imgconvert.skimg.limg(skimg)
imgconvert.skimg.limg.summary: Convert a skimg image to a limg image.

long_press.name: long_press
long_press.summary: This event is called when the user long presses the screen, for longer than SkyOS.settings.longPressDelay or 500 milliseconds by default.

pan.name: pan
pan.summary: This event is queued while the user clicks and drags on the screen.

pan_up.name: pan_up
pan_up.summary: This event is called when the pan event ends, and the mouse button is lifted.

pastebin.name: pastebin
pastebin.summary: Provides a pastebin api to interact with pastebin without using the pastebin shell command.

piston.name: piston
piston.summary: A small api to control a Create Mechanical Piston The setup requires (by default) a redstone line to lower the piston on...

piston.piston.curHeight.name: piston.piston.curHeight
piston.piston.curHeight.summary: Current height of the piston, this should always match the piston in the world.

piston.piston.lower.name: piston.piston.lower([blocks=1])
piston.piston.lower.summary: Lower the piston a set amount of blocks.

piston.piston.raise.name: piston.piston.raise([blocks=1])
piston.piston.raise.summary: Raise the piston a set amount of blocks.

piston.piston:ground.name: piston.piston:ground()
piston.piston:ground.summary: Lower the piston to the bottom.

piston.piston:max.name: piston.piston:max()
piston.piston:max.summary: Raise the piston to it's maximum extension

progressbar.name: progressbar
progressbar.summary: progress bar is an api for drawing & updating progress bars.

progressbar.bar.update.name: progressbar.bar.update(percent)
progressbar.bar.update.summary: Update the bar to a percentage from 0 to 100.

progressbar.bar:redraw.name: progressbar.bar:redraw()
progressbar.bar:redraw.summary: Redraw the bar, putting it overtop of whatever has been drawn since.

progressbar.create.name: progressbar.create(x, y, w, h, fg, bg [, fill [, terminal]])

roll20.name: roll20
roll20.summary: roll20 is just a library of various functions to condition text & files into roll20 macros/statements

roll20.conditionCharacters.name: roll20.conditionCharacters(str)
roll20.conditionCharacters.summary: Swap out characters for the code equivalent &# character.

roll20.makeDiceRoll.name: roll20.makeDiceRoll(numDice, diceSides, modifier, inline)
roll20.makeDiceRoll.summary: Take some parameters, spit out a dice roll string.

roll20.makePrompt.name: roll20.makePrompt(promptName, choices)
roll20.makePrompt.summary: Takes a prompt and a table of choices, and generates a roll20 prompt string.

sUtils.name: sUtils
sUtils.summary: sUtils is a utility api with a large amount of functions for various purposes

sUtils.asset.draw.name: sUtils.asset.draw(image, opts [, tOutput])
sUtils.asset.draw.summary: Draw an image produced by load.

sUtils.asset.drawBlit.name: sUtils.asset.drawBlit(blit [, x [, y [, output]]])
sUtils.asset.drawBlit.summary: drawBlit is like drawSkimg, but for a normal blit table.

sUtils.asset.drawSkimg.name: sUtils.asset.drawSkimg(skimg [, x [, y [, output]]])
sUtils.asset.drawSkimg.summary: drawSkimg takes a skimg table, and draws it at the specified location

sUtils.asset.skimg.generateDefaultSkimg.name: sUtils.asset.skimg.generateDefaultSkimg(width, height, creator, locked)
sUtils.asset.skimg.generateDefaultSkimg.summary: Generates a skimg image with the provided width, and height.

sUtils.asset.skimg.getAttributes.name: sUtils.asset.skimg.getAttributes(image)
sUtils.asset.skimg.getAttributes.summary: Get the attributes of a .skimg file or image table.

sUtils.cache.name: sUtils.cache
sUtils.cache.summary: Cache functions, stores files in a cache for faster access.

sUtils.cache.cacheData.name: sUtils.cache.cacheData
sUtils.cache.cacheData.summary: Cache where the files are stored, it's key/value with cache[path] = contents.

sUtils.cache.cacheLoad.name: sUtils.cache.cacheLoad(path)
sUtils.cache.cacheLoad.summary: Load a file, checks if it's in the cache, if so, return that, if not, return the file and put it in cache.

sUtils.cache.reload.name: sUtils.cache.reload(path)
sUtils.cache.reload.summary: Reload a file in the cache, overwriting it with the new contents.

sUtils.confirm.name: sUtils.confirm()
sUtils.confirm.summary: Read user input, compare it to a table of agree phrases.

sUtils.countLines.name: sUtils.countLines(file)
sUtils.countLines.summary: Count the number of lines in the file.

sUtils.cut.name: sUtils.cut(str, len [, pad])
sUtils.cut.summary: Cut or pad a string to length.

sUtils.deepCopy.name: sUtils.deepCopy(tbl)
sUtils.deepCopy.summary: Deep copy a table, recurses to nested tables.

sUtils.diceRoll.name: sUtils.diceRoll(size, modifier, dc)
sUtils.diceRoll.summary: Roll a dice with a specified modifier, and check if it passes the DC.

sUtils.encfread.name: sUtils.encfread(Path)
sUtils.encfread.summary: encfread reads a file, and unserializes the lua object.

sUtils.encfwrite.name: sUtils.encfwrite(path, object)
sUtils.encfwrite.summary: Serialize a lua object, and write it to a file.

sUtils.fread.name: sUtils.fread(file)
sUtils.fread.summary: Read the contents of a file.

sUtils.generateRandom.name: sUtils.generateRandom()
sUtils.generateRandom.summary: Generate a random number based on math.

sUtils.getFile.name: sUtils.getFile(file, url)
sUtils.getFile.summary: Grab a file from the internet and save it in the file path.

sUtils.getSize.name: sUtils.getSize(path [, ignoreRom=false])
sUtils.getSize.summary: Recursively get the size of a folder.

sUtils.getTime.name: sUtils.getTime([offset])
sUtils.getTime.summary: Get the current time with an offset from UTC.

sUtils.getZeroTime.name: sUtils.getZeroTime([offset])
sUtils.getZeroTime.summary: Get the current time in a table of strings prepended with 0 if they're single digit.

sUtils.insert.name: sUtils.insert(tbl, value)
sUtils.insert.summary: Check if a value is already in a table, if not, insert it.

sUtils.isOdd.name: sUtils.isOdd(num)
sUtils.isOdd.summary: Returns a boolean on if the number is odd or not.

sUtils.keyContains.name: sUtils.keyContains(Table, value)
sUtils.keyContains.summary: Loop through a table, and check if it contains the value specified

sUtils.numericallyContains.name: sUtils.numericallyContains(Table, value)
sUtils.numericallyContains.summary: Loop through a table, and check if it contains the value specified

sUtils.poke.name: sUtils.poke(Path)
sUtils.poke.summary: Poke a file, creating it if it doesn't exist.

sUtils.readNumber.name: sUtils.readNumber()
sUtils.readNumber.summary: Read user input, return tonumber() of it.

sUtils.remove.name: sUtils.remove(tbl, value)
sUtils.remove.summary: Remove all values from a table.

sUtils.savequire.name: sUtils.savequire(url)
sUtils.savequire.summary: savequire uses webquire but will also save the file and use that if it's found.

sUtils.shallowCopy.name: sUtils.shallowCopy(tbl)
sUtils.shallowCopy.summary: Shallow copy a table, not recursive so doesn't copy table elements.

sUtils.splice.name: sUtils.splice(str, pos, char [, replace])
sUtils.splice.summary: Splice and insert a character into a string.

sUtils.split.name: sUtils.split(inputstr, sep)
sUtils.split.summary: Split a string by it's separator.

sUtils.webquire.name: sUtils.webquire(url)
sUtils.webquire.summary: Webquire is a require but for URLs

skimg.name: skimg
skimg.summary: This is just the skimg parts of sUtils, to load a little quicker when starting SkyOS and displaying images.

skimg.load.name: skimg.load(path)
skimg.load.summary: Load a skimg from a file.

skyrtle.back.name: skyrtle.back([blocks=1])
skyrtle.back.summary: Move the turtle backward N (default 1) blocks.

skyrtle.calcFacing.name: skyrtle.calcFacing()
skyrtle.calcFacing.summary: Get the current facing of the turtle.

skyrtle.down.name: skyrtle.down([blocks=1])
skyrtle.down.summary: Move the turtle down N times.

skyrtle.farm.farm.name: skyrtle.farm.farm(length, width, check)
skyrtle.farm.farm.summary: A standard farm function, runs the check function and if it passes it will dig down, and place down the seed.

skyrtle.forward.name: skyrtle.forward([blocks=1])
skyrtle.forward.summary: Move the turtle forward N (default 1) blocks.

skyrtle.getFacing.name: skyrtle.getFacing()
skyrtle.getFacing.summary: Get the current facing of the turtle.

skyrtle.getPosition.name: skyrtle.getPosition()
skyrtle.getPosition.summary: Get the current position of the turtle.

skyrtle.hijack.name: skyrtle.hijack(gps)
skyrtle.hijack.summary: Hijack the turtle API and replace it with Skyrtle functions.

skyrtle.restore.name: skyrtle.restore()
skyrtle.restore.summary: Restore the turtle API and the GPS api

skyrtle.setFacing.name: skyrtle.setFacing(dir)
skyrtle.setFacing.summary: Set the current facing of the turtle

skyrtle.setPosition.name: skyrtle.setPosition(x, y, z)
skyrtle.setPosition.summary: Set the current position of the turtle.

skyrtle.turnLeft.name: skyrtle.turnLeft([turns=1])
skyrtle.turnLeft.summary: Turn the turtle left N times.

skyrtle.turnRight.name: skyrtle.turnRight([turns=1])
skyrtle.turnRight.summary: Turn the turtle right N times.

skyrtle.up.name: skyrtle.up([blocks=1])
skyrtle.up.summary: Move the turtle up N times.

sos.name: sos
sos.summary: sos is a library that contains functions pertaining to SkyOS itself

sos.desktop.name: sos.desktop
sos.desktop.summary: Functions to interact with the desktop file.

sos.desktop.insertApp.name: sos.desktop.insertApp(...)
sos.desktop.insertApp.summary: Insert an app into the desktop.

sos.screenshot.name: sos.screenshot()
sos.screenshot.summary: Screenshot the screen, and save it to /screenshots/hhmmss-ddmmyyyy.skimg

swipe.name: swipe
swipe.summary: This event is called when the user swipes on the screen.

tcp.name: tcp
tcp.summary: Send packets of data, and make sure they're received.

timeserver.name: timeserver
timeserver.summary: timeserver api contacts a timeserver computer in the world, and requests the current time This API was just a test of how modems worked, it really should not be used.

timeserver.get.name: timeserver.get(offset)
timeserver.get.summary: Contact the timeserver, return what the timeserver sends back.

travel.name: travel
travel.summary: An API to travel to coordinates using Plethora's Kinetic Augment.

travel.travel.name: travel.travel(x, y, z)
travel.travel.summary: Move player to set of coordinates within 50 blocks

visible.name: visible
visible.summary: visible is queued whenever the window changes it's visibility state, and therefore active state.

windowman.activeWindow.name: windowman.activeWindow = 0
windowman.activeWindow.summary: Currently active widnow, index wins with this.

windowman.bottombarOpen.name: windowman.bottombarOpen = true
windowman.bottombarOpen.summary: Whether or not the bottom bar is open.

windowman.closeWindow.name: windowman.closeWindow(win)
windowman.closeWindow.summary: Close a window, it calls SkyOS.close() and then kills the process.

windowman.foreground.name: windowman.foreground(window)
windowman.foreground.summary: Bring a window to the foreground, also calls the SkyOS.visible(isVisible) callback functions.

windowman.newWindow.name: windowman.newWindow(program [, name [, visible [, env, ...]]])
windowman.newWindow.summary: Create a new window with a function to run The table resulting from this function (stored in SkyOS.window.wins) will be indexed key/value with the window's id.

windowman.topbarOpen.name: windowman.topbarOpen = true
windowman.topbarOpen.summary: Whether or not the top bar is open.

windowman.wins.name: windowman.wins
windowman.wins.summary: Windows that currently exist(and are running)
